notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

descriptions: Typical climate data composed of either measured or modeled data, or both
Climate data from atmospheric reanalysis models used to provide weather and climatic data for historical periods worldwide
Climate data from numerical weather forecast models used to provide short term forecasts of weather conditions
Projected climate data from a numerical model of the global climate system that provide estimates of future weather data driven by meteorological and human factors

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

name.description: Descriptive name of the weather station location
name.notes: Suggest including human-readable identifiers of location, e.g., country, state

subdivision.notes: State, province, or other identified region

time_zone_offset.description: Time zone offset relative to UTC

elevation.description: Station elevation relative to sea level (bottom of station)

anemometer_height.description: Height of anemometer above the ground
anemometer_height.notes: Typically 10 m (potentially move to Time Series Source for Wind Speed/Direction)

station_height.description: Height of other meteorological measurements above the ground

terrain_class.description: Roughness class of terrain surrounding weather station
terrain_class.notes: Needs better definition, esp. enumeration of list.

data_sets.description: An array of climate data sets for this location

descriptions: Typical climate data composed of either measured or modeled data, or both
Climate data from atmospheric reanalysis models used to provide weather and climatic data for historical periods worldwide
Climate data from numerical weather forecast models used to provide short term forecasts of weather conditions
Projected climate data from a numerical model of the global climate system that provide estimates of future weather data driven by meteorological and human factors

time_intervals.description: Array of TimeInterval data groups whose ids may be referenced within TimeSeries data groups

starting_time.notes: Used to determine the "previous" timestamp for the first value in a time series where the time series is not instantaneous

labels.description: Informal labels describing each time interval
labels.notes: e.g., Month names for monthly intervals

time_series.description: Data group containing named TimeSeries data elements

horizontal_infrared_sky_irradiance.notes: Integrated power at each wavelength between 3 um and 100 um at an instant in time, received on a horizontal detector. Downward flux only. Metadata for this variable should declare whether this quantity is modelled, including which model was used, or whether it is measured. If it is measured, the detector"s range should be declared if different from nominal as defined for this variable.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

total_sky_cover.notes: Fraction of sky dome covered by clouds or obscuring phenomena. Usually measured in eights or tenths.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

opaque_sky_cover.notes: Fraction of sky dome covered by opaque clouds or obscuring phenomena. Usually measured in eights or tenths.

precipitable_water.notes: Total amount of water in a column of unit area from the elevation of the station to the upper troposphere. Includes clouds.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

aerosol_optical_depth.notes: Extinction coefficient for a collimated beam traveling through the atmosphere, denoting the extinction of a beam as it traverses the atmosphere. The natural log of the ratio of incident to transmitted radiant power. Described using Beer"s law (transmission, scattering, and absorption).

horizontal_infrared_sky_irradiance.notes: Integrated power at each wavelength between 3 um and 100 um at an instant in time, received on a horizontal detector. Downward flux only. Metadata for this variable should declare whether this quantity is modelled, including which model was used, or whether it is measured. If it is measured, the detector"s range should be declared if different from nominal as defined for this variable.

total_sky_cover.notes: Fraction of sky dome covered by clouds or obscuring phenomena. Usually measured in eights or tenths.

precipitable_water.notes: Total amount of water in a column of unit area from the elevation of the station to the upper troposphere. Includes clouds.

aerosol_optical_depth.notes: Extinction coefficient for a collimated beam traveling through the atmosphere, denoting the extinction of a beam as it traverses the atmosphere. The natural log of the ratio of incident to transmitted radiant power. Described using Beer"s law (transmission, scattering, and absorption).

data_model.notes: Identifies the data model where the schema is defined

schema.notes: Identifies the schema used to define the data content

schema_version.description: Version of the root schema this data complies with

description.description: Description of data content (suitable for display)

id.notes: Assigned by *data publisher* to identify this data. `id` shall remain unchanged for revisions of the same data.

data_timestamp.notes: Date/time of publication of this data.

data_version.description: Integer version identifier for the data
data_version.notes: Used by *data publisher* to track revisions of the data. `data_version` shall be incremented for each data revision.

disclaimer.description: Characterization of accuracy, limitations, and applicability of this data

name.description: Descriptive name of the weather station location
name.notes: Suggest including human-readable identifiers of location, e.g., country, state

subdivision.notes: State, province, or other identified region

time_zone_offset.description: Time zone offset relative to UTC

elevation.description: Station elevation relative to sea level (bottom of station)

anemometer_height.description: Height of anemometer above the ground
anemometer_height.notes: Typically 10 m (potentially move to Time Series Source for Wind Speed/Direction)

station_height.description: Height of other meteorological measurements above the ground

terrain_class.description: Roughness class of terrain surrounding weather station
terrain_class.notes: Needs better definition, esp. enumeration of list.

data_sets.description: An array of climate data sets for this location

descriptions: Typical climate data composed of either measured or modeled data, or both
Climate data from atmospheric reanalysis models used to provide weather and climatic data for historical periods worldwide
Climate data from numerical weather forecast models used to provide short term forecasts of weather conditions
Projected climate data from a numerical model of the global climate system that provide estimates of future weather data driven by meteorological and human factors

time_intervals.description: Array of TimeInterval data groups whose ids may be referenced within TimeSeries data groups

starting_time.notes: Used to determine the "previous" timestamp for the first value in a time series where the time series is not instantaneous

labels.description: Informal labels describing each time interval
labels.notes: e.g., Month names for monthly intervals

time_series.description: Data group containing named TimeSeries data elements

horizontal_infrared_sky_irradiance.notes: Integrated power at each wavelength between 3 um and 100 um at an instant in time, received on a horizontal detector. Downward flux only. Metadata for this variable should declare whether this quantity is modelled, including which model was used, or whether it is measured. If it is measured, the detector"s range should be declared if different from nominal as defined for this variable.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

total_sky_cover.notes: Fraction of sky dome covered by clouds or obscuring phenomena. Usually measured in eights or tenths.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

opaque_sky_cover.notes: Fraction of sky dome covered by opaque clouds or obscuring phenomena. Usually measured in eights or tenths.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

precipitable_water.notes: Total amount of water in a column of unit area from the elevation of the station to the upper troposphere. Includes clouds.

notes: Values reflect the instant of the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the average between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the integrated sum between the previous timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group
Values reflect the cumulative sum between the starting timestamp and the current timestamp in the corresponding TimeIntervals data group

aerosol_optical_depth.notes: Extinction coefficient for a collimated beam traveling through the atmosphere, denoting the extinction of a beam as it traverses the atmosphere. The natural log of the ratio of incident to transmitted radiant power. Described using Beer"s law (transmission, scattering, and absorption).
